results.title: Back room of the sky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
A survey of work carried out at the Ministry of Aviation Research Centre at Boscombe Down. Aiming always for increased safety and efficiency, all sections of a new aircraft must be rigorously tested and teams of pilots, scientists and engineers seek out any flaws which must be corrected before a machine becomes operational. The men who will fly the aircraft are also seen undergoing tests at Boscombe Down. Narrated by Raymond Baxter.

group_siblings.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold

results.title: Silver's new shine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Today silver plays a new role in Britain. Since 1947 it has ceased to be used in British coinage and is put to work more and more widely in a variety of industries. Old silver coins are refined at the Royal Mint, to supply industry with more of this precious mineral, also used in the fine silver work for which Britain’s silversmith’s are traditionally famous.

group_siblings.title: We are the Lambeth Boys
group_siblings.creator_credit: Karel Reisz, Leon Clore and Graphic Films

results.title: We are the Lambeth Boys
results.creator_credit: Karel Reisz, Leon Clore and Graphic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Britain”.
”Free cinema” documentary about the work and leisure time of a group of teenagers in an urban industrial community. Shot in and around a Kensington youth club, this film is pitched between social documentary and personal expression. Gives an idea of the realistic way in which the club is run, but concentrates on the young people themselves, their involvement with life, their problems and potentialities. While some comment is made, the young people are mostly left to speak for themselves, with their expressive hands, watchful eyes and the richness of their words. Commentary by Jon Rollason. Music by John Dankworth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karel Reisz, Leon Clore and Graphic Films

group_works.title: Indian cooking, Parsi style
group_works.creator_credit: Perkan Productions

results.title: Indian cooking, Parsi style
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look ‘n’ Cook”.
The Parsi community originated 1,353 years ago, when a small group of people migrated from ancient Persia to India. Today there are hardly 100,000 members of this community in existence. The secrets of their culinary art - the ingredients and style of their cooking - are revealed in this program.

results.title: Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Hosted by Justine Shapiro, this Lonely Planet video explores the subterranean tunnels once inhabited by the Vietcong, takes part in new years celebrations with fireworks heralding the arrival of a new year, takes alternative medicine- drinking snake juice to ward off sickness, and riding the Reunification express.
